intro: Xatardia pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, elongated fruits. Xatardia pyrenaica is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution.
